items.content_html:
Fixes #24734 by simply using the W3C specification's description of how browsers should render images with these values.

Description

Changes the description of rendering algorithms used for image-rendering of pixelated or crisp-edges to match the W3C specification.

Motivation

The old description used specific algorithms, but rendering engines use different algorithms, at least for crisp-edges, which the W3C spec is open to.

Additional details

https://www.w3.org/TR/css-images-3/#valdef-image-rendering-crisp-edges
https://www.w3.org/TR/css-images-3/#valdef-image-rendering-pixelated

Related issues and pull requests

Fixes #24734
items.title: Matched "crisp-edges" and "pixelated" image-rendering to W3C spec

items.content_html:
Description

the previous version as follow, its obviously illegal.

/* Using the `fill` keyword */
border-image-slice: 10% fill 7 12;
items.title: Fix typo

items.content_html:
Description

The table of common JavaScript feature-detection methods was not (IMHO) particularly readable, squashed into too-narrow columns even at maximum width. Using vertically-stacked sections instead of table rows gives the content room to breathe.

Motivation

Improve readability of explanations and code examples (including enabling syntax highlighting, not available inside the table).

Additional details

  • As an added benefit, the Note box regarding double-negation (!!) is now located immediately after the example code it refers to, instead of being placed below the entire table.
  • For flow reasons, the mention of undetectable features (linking to Modernizr's list) is now part of the introduction to the JS section (before the patterns) instead of at the end.

Related issues and pull requests

None.
items.title: Feature detection: Replace table with subsections

items.content_html:
Description

Release note covering the implementation of runtime.onSuspend and runtime.onSuspendCanceled.

Additional details

See Bug 1753850
items.title: Release notes for runtime.onSuspend

items.content_html:
The 'Showing file(s) size' example includes a for...of statement to iterate through the file array. However, this loop construct has not been introduced previously on the page; instead a classic for loop with an iteration variable is shown as a method of iterating through FileList entries.

To prevent potential confusion, this change mentions the for...of statement and gives a snippet of how to use it before it's referenced in the example.

This change prevents potential confusion caused by the current documentation using a different loop statement for the example than was used immediately prior.

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: Reference for...of statement before usage in example

items.content_html:
Description

This PR is just one step within the larger PWA docs refresh project: mdn/mdn#280

One of the steps we need to do in this larger project is create a new sidebar, which this PR does not do. @wbamberg is working on in mdn/yari#8238.

This PR adds one new How to page to the PWA docs about display mode.

Motivation

In the PWA docs refresh project, we agreed to create a new How to section that will contain 10 to 20 new pages about many of the features that PWAs can use. Display mode is one of them.

Related issues and pull requests

  • Related to mdn/mdn#280

Next step

Once reviewed and approved, the idea is to merge this in a way that doesn't necessarily appears on MDN just yet. Once we have enough of the new content that we think is useful, we will release the new sidebar and/or landing page to link to the new stuff.
items.title: Add a new display mode How-to page to PWA docs

items.content_html: Some functions don't have their own page, as they are specific to one property. I'm using a link with a fragment. I also uniformized the use of parentheses.
items.title: Fix red links to documented CSS functions

items.content_html:
Description

This PR adds docs for the View Transitions Module Level 1, which is available in Chrome 111+.

See my research document for more information on exactly what this work entails.

A couple of notes:

  • My basic demo is currently contained in a glitch instance, but I am happy to change the URLs over as soon as the dom-examples repo version has been merged.
  • For details on what exactly happens in the transition style sheet during a view transition, I've linked to relevant sections of the spec. I looked into this and felt that this was quite complex and mostly a set of internal details, which most people won't care about, but you might possibly need it if you are creating custom view transitions and want full knowledge of what you are overriding. Let me know what you think.

Motivation

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests

Fixes #24425
items.title: Add docs for the View Transitions Module Level 1
